block.p: Karen Beth Kaufman, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James Kaufman of Newton, Mass., was married yesterday to Ian Kenneth Harris, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Harris of New York and London. The Rev. Daniel Chesney Kanter, a Unitarian minister, officiated at the Harvard Club in Boston.

Mrs. Harris, 30, is a management consultant in New York with Bain & Company. She graduated from Stanford University and received an M.B.A. degree with distinction from Harvard. Her father is a kidney specialist at the Veterans Affairs Boston Healthcare System and an associate professor of medicine at Boston University School of Medicine.

Karen Beth Kaufman, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James Kaufman of Newton, Mass., was married yesterday to Ian Kenneth Harris, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Harris of New York and London. The Rev. Daniel Chesney Kanter, a Unitarian minister, officiated at the Harvard Club in Boston.

Mrs. Harris, 30, is a management consultant in New York with Bain & Company. She graduated from Stanford University and received an M.B.A. degree with distinction from Harvard. Her father is a kidney specialist at the Veterans Affairs Boston Healthcare System and an associate professor of medicine at Boston University School of Medicine.

Mr. Harris, 31, is a sales trader for over-the-counter stocks at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter in New York. He graduated with honors from Edinburgh University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern.
His father is the British consul general in New York; from 1994 to 1997 he was the British ambassador to South Korea.
